title: COVID-19 Vaccine at HealthNet - HealthNet of Rock County
description: HealthNet is providing the Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine to eligible individuals. Make an appointment to get vaccinated at HealthNet!
cleaned_text: County is currently providing the COVID-19 vaccine and boosters to eligible Rock County residents on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays in the morning. Fill out the form below or [Contact](https://healthnet-rock.org/contact/) HealthNet if you are interested in receiving your vaccine at our clinic! *We are providing the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine, which is only for individuals age 18 and older.* For more information, visit [RockCountyShot.com](http://Rockcountyshot.com) Booster Shot Calendar Wednesdays 1:00PM - 3:30PM (appointment required) 1st and 2nd Dose Calendar Monday & Friday 8:30AM - 4:00PM (walk-in appointments welcome) Frequently Asked Questions [COVID-19 vaccines are effective](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/effectiveness/index.html) and can lower your risk of getting and spreading the virus that causes COVID-19. Vaccines also help prevent serious illness and death in children and adults even [if they do get COVID-19](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/effectiveness/why-measure-effectiveness/breakthrough-cases.html). Yes. The COVID-19 Vaccine is available to everyone, regardless of citizenship or immigration status. Receiving the Vaccine will not affect one's immigration status. HealthNet of Rock County follows CDC guidelines for administering the vaccine to eligible individuals.
